results.title: Joshua Cooks & Dragon
results.creator_credit: Lucy MacLaren, Penny Robenstone and Swinburne Institute of Technology. Film and Television School
results.brief_description: Through making a cake, a little boy gains some sense of independence and growth. Within this he struggles with fantasy versus reality to achieve an end product he can be proud of. Plus the story of two young girls who leave a dragon on a tram and go to the depot at night to find it.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Lucy MacLaren, Penny Robenstone and Swinburne Institute of Technology. Film and Television School

results.title: The Fogbrook Thing
results.creator_credit: Mark Osborne and Swinburne Institute of Technology. Film and Television School
results.brief_description: Set in the mid-Sixties, this film accompanies Peter Young on his first camping trip with the Boy Scouts - deep into the bush, into a place of myths and folklore and fearful adventures. (ATOM Award 1987).

results.title: Seaside Stories = Gumdrop makes a start and nine other ...
results.creator_credit: Gerben Cath and International Video Books
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Dorothy Butler’s Video Books”.
Dorothy Butler introduces this video which is designed to encourage children to read and enjoy books. Storytellers, John Hawkesby and Phillipa Dann tell a small group of children ten stories, many from well known books, as they enjoy a day beside the sea. The stories are: Gumdrop makes a start, Dinosaurs and all that rubbish, Pa’s top hat, Spacers space rescue service, Lift off to danger, The frog prince, Alex’s bed, Ice creams for Rosie, Master Money the millionaire and Sam and the dog from the sea.

results.title: Bedtime Stories
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Dorothy Butler’s Video Books”.
A video designed to encourage children to read and enjoy books. Ten different stories, many from well known books, are told by professional storytellers and have been selected for children aged one to five years old.

results.title: The Huge Adventures of Trevor a Cat/Foxbat and the Mimi
results.creator_credit: John Skibinski, John Taylor and Swinburne Institute of Technology. Film and Television School
results.brief_description: The hilarious story of a cat, whose hunting instincts are accidentally over-revived, plus the story of a flying fox which takes shelter in a cave, something he regrets when cave spirits attempt to capture him. Rated: G

results.title: Kiss me Petruchio
results.creator_credit: Christopher Dixon, Wilford Leach, Joseph Papp and New York Shakespeare Festival
results.brief_description: An amusing, fast-paced documentary based on the New York Shakespeare Festival’s production of “The Taming of the Shrew” starring Meryl Streep and Raul Julia. The film goes behind the scenes to find out what makes the 400-year-old play relevant to audiences today. Combines excerpts from the performance, with comments by the leading actors and members of the audience.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Christopher Dixon, Wilford Leach, Joseph Papp and New York Shakespeare Festival

results.title: If I Tell You a Secret : Interviewing (TEFC)
results.creator_credit: Bobb Bragg, Heidi Oatman and Richard Baker
results.brief_description: Details appropriate techniques to be used when interviewing the sexually abused child in order to obtain information that may be critical in ensuing court cases.

results.title: Facing it: my friend's an alcoholic
results.creator_credit: William Haugse, George McQuilkin and Churchill Films
results.brief_description: Terry, 17, has a drinking and drug problem and his friend, A.J., is being drawn into it. A.J. at first covers for Terry, then tries to intervene. Finally he realises, with the assistance of Terry’s girlfriend, that they need outside help.

results.title: The Food Connection (TEFC)
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Can You Avoid Cancer?”.
Some major cancers seem to follow the Western way of life, and many surprising clues point towards our food The members of a family look at their typical eating habits and try some changes which could keep them healthier.
